meanings.definition: Exempted or allowed to continue under a previous set of rules or regulations.
meanings.sent1: The grandfathered policy remained unchanged despite the new regulations.
meanings.sent2: The grandfathered building was not required to make the updates.
meanings.sent3: The grandfathered status of the old car made it the envy of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfathered position in the company gave her a sense of security.
meanings.sent5: The grandfathered tradition was cherished by all the members of the community.

meanings.definition: To include or exempt (someone or something) from new rules or regulations based on a previous status or condition.
meanings.sent1: The company grandfathered existing employees into the new benefit plan.
meanings.sent2: They grandfathered the historic building to preserve its original architecture.
meanings.sent3: He grandfathered his favorite pen to avoid losing it.
meanings.sent4: The school grandfathered the students who had already completed the required courses.
meanings.sent5: She grandfathered her loyal customers by offering them special discounts.
